alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 08 at 4:27PM EDT until September 08 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Northeastern Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 427 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Browns Mills, or 16 miles west of Toms River, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Presidential Lakes Estates, Lakehurst, Cassville, Presidential Lakes, Woodruff, Cedar Glen Lakes, Six Flags Theme Park, Whiting, Cedar Glen West, Browns Mills, Leisure Village West-Pine Lake Park, Country Lake Estates, Leisure Knoll, New Egypt, Crestwood Village and Fort Dix. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. In addition to large hail and damaging winds, frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
